paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted genetic variant information for the TTR gene, including penetrance data.

patients.demographics: 3-4% of the Afro-Caribbean and African American population
patients.phenotype: late-onset severe cardiac involvement with highly symptomatic heart failure

individual_records.phenotype_details: severe cardiac involvement with heart failure
individual_records.evidence_sentence: Val122Ile TTR variant is associated with late-onset (median age of 69 years) severe cardiac involvement with highly symptomatic HF.

functional_data.summary: The Val122Ile variant leads to destabilization of the TTR tetramer, promoting amyloid fibril formation.

variants.segregation_data: Segregates with disease in families, particularly in Afro-Caribbean and African American populations.
variants.population_frequency: 3-4% in Afro-Caribbean and African American populations
variants.additional_notes: The Val122Ile variant is the most common pathogenic TTR variant in the United States.
key_quotes: Disease penetrance is estimated to be around 20%, accounting for 25,000 affected individuals in the United States.
Val122Ile TTR variant is associated with late-onset (median age of 69 years) severe cardiac involvement with highly symptomatic HF.

patients.demographics: 1% of the population in northwest Ireland

functional_data.summary: The Thr60Ala variant is associated with a mixed phenotype of cardiomyopathy and neuropathy.

variants.additional_notes: Median delay from symptom onset to diagnosis is around 2 years.
key_quotes: Thr60Ala is one of the most common causes of ATTRv amyloidosis in the United Kingdom.

functional_data.summary: The Val30Met variant leads to variable phenotypic expression, with early or late onset.

variants.additional_notes: The majority of Val30Met subjects in Portugal were early-onset.
key_quotes: Val30Met TTR variant is the most common disease-causing TTR variant in Europe.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant TTR variants and penetrance data were extracted successfully.
